skills.name: Stopp
skills.definition: Stop! - Take a breath - Observe - Pull back - Practice and/or Proceed

skills.name: It will pass
skills.definition: Thoughts and feelings come and go. Situations change. Sometimes all we can do is keep going. It will pass.

skills.name: Distract
skills.definition: What can I do right now to help me focus on something else, instead of my distress?

skills.name: Do One Thing
skills.definition: Do One Thing. Choose something to do. Do it mindfully. How long for? 20 minutes!

skills.name: Turn The Mind
skills.definition: Choose to take the new resourceful and helpful way. Use a skill! If you always do what you always did, you'll always get what you always got.

skills.name: Right Now
skills.definition: Right Now: 5 things I can see - 4 things I can hear - 3 things I can touch - 2 things I can smell - 1 slow deep breath.

skills.name: Soothe
skills.definition: What can I use to soothe myself? Soothe my senses. What is in my sooth bag/box/app that will help me to feel better?

skills.name: Values
skills.definition: What are my values? What is really important to me? What can I do that will help me take a step towards my chosen life direction?

skills.name: Breathe
skills.definition: Focus attention on the breath. Imagine a balloon inflating on the in-breath, and deflating on the out-breath.

skills.name: Observe
skills.definition: Take the helicopter view! Pull back. What's the bigger picture?

skills.name: This Moment
skills.definition: Focus on the here and now, in this moment. Say to yourself: 'I am sitting' or 'I am walking'. 'I am looking' or 'I am listening'. 'I am breathing'. Notice the sensations of that activity in this moment.

skills.name: Focus
skills.definition: Where is my focus of attention? What am I thinking about? Where do I want to focus?

skills.name: Drift
skills.definition: Am I drifting? Is my attention wandering? Bring attention back to my chosen focus.

skills.name: Fact or Option
skills.definition: Ask yourself: Is this thought fact or opinion? Come back to the FACTS!

skills.name: Wise Mind
skills.definition: Taking reasonable mind and emotion mind into consideration.... What would Wise Mind make of this?

skills.name: Keep Calm And Carry On
skills.definition: Focus on your chosen slogan or positive self talk statement to help you cope during distressing times.

skills.name: Self Care
skills.definition: Sleep - Eating & Exercise - Look at other factors - Find fun, achievement and enjoyment - every day. Be kind to yourself!

skills.name: Thinking
skills.definition: Don't believe everything you think! Thoughts are just thoughts.

skills.name: Name The Emotion
skills.definition: What emotion am I feeling right now? I can notice the urge to react, and choose a more helpful response.

skills.name: Opposite Action
skills.definition: Notice the emotional action urge - and do the opposite. If anxious, instead of escape/avoid - approach. If angry, instead of attack - kind approach or gently withdraw. If depressed, instead of withdraw/isolate - do something, be with others.

skills.name: Sieve or Sponge
skills.definition: What thoughts am I sponging? What am I sieving? What can I start to notice instead?

skills.name: Build Positive Experiences
skills.definition: What can I do to add more colour into my life? More nourishing and less depleting activities.

skills.name: Balance
skills.definition: Where am I on my personal scale? What can I do to help balance myself?

skills.name: Pace & Plan
skills.definition: Play - Achieve - Care - Energise - Prepare - List - Action - Notice

skills.name: Listen
skills.definition: I have 2 ears and only one mouth! How can I show that I'm really listening?

skills.name: Respect
skills.definition: The more I give - the more I get. Respect myself & others - Treat others as I want to be treated

skills.name: Reflect
skills.definition: What can I learn about what happened? What went well? What didn't go so well? What can I do differently next time?

skills.name: Crystal Clear
skills.definition: Concise - Lucid & Logical - Emotion-free expression - Assertive - Realistic.

skills.name: Ask or Say No
skills.definition: How can I ask someone what I really want to ask for? It's OK to say no - I can say it in a way that is OK for me as well as the other person.

skills.name: Maintain Relationship
skills.definition: Say in touch with friends, family and important others. When you're feeling low, let someone know.

skills.name: Talk the Talk
skills.definition: Communicate assertively. Smile - warm & friendly - relaxed - comfortable eye contact.

skills.name: End Or Mend
skills.definition: Is this relationship healthy for me? How can I end or mend this relationship? Can I keep a door open?
